about_the_game:
Norowareta: The Three Treasures is a first-person survival horror game set in Edo period Japan from a small team of game development students working under the name of Studio Crying Spider.


Assume the role of Lumi as she travels back to Japan in search of uncovering her past, only to find herself in an abnormal situation dragged back in time. Explore an isolated shrine tormented by the events of the past only equipped with a lantern and your trusty journal.

Solve puzzles and uncover the shrine's unspoken secrets and the terrors of one fateful night. Unravel the story of the former residents and those who were against them. Figure out what happened - is everyone else dead? What is the purpose of the three sacred treasures? Who is the malevolent entity that keeps whispering from the deep?

Navigate your way through the horrors buried deep beneath the shrine grounds and try to find your way out before one malevolent entity that controls the souls of the deep. Use the vast environment and items at hand as the means to defend yourself and find your way to escape before it's too late.


  • A large game world to explore with rewards and the possibility to move freely between explored areas
  • Scavenge for items and resources to aid you on your journey
  • Various puzzles and riddles guarding the shrine's most well-kept secrets and mysteries
  • Uncover the shrine's dark history — a tale of betrayal, revenge, and spirits unable to find peace
  • Discover the three sacred treasures kept in the depths in the shrine
  • Tormented souls and malevolent entities haunting anyone traversing through the dark-lit corridors


Norowareta: The Three Treasures takes heavy inspiration from retro horror games, heavily inspiring the game feel and visuals. Rather than taking all of the inspirations as technical restrictions, Norowareta takes them as visual and mechanical tools to aid in the game's atmosphere and unique game feel.

content_descriptors.notes: Norowareta: The Three Treasures contains mature content that some audiences might find disturbing or triggering. The story features topics like mass murder, human sacrifice and suicide. The gameplay includes violence and implications of violence. The game does not feature frequent gore, but some of the enemy designs might appear unsettling for some players and might trigger arachnophobia.

short_description: Embark on a chilling journey as a young woman uncovers her past, answering the call of a tormented soul. Explore an isolated shrine in Japan and be transported back to the Edo period. Navigate through the mysteries and terrors of a fateful night in this spine-chilling horror survival game.
